Are we trying to define the word "evolution" or "The
Theory of Evolution".  That makes a difference in this
context.  "Evolution", the word, and in the biological
context, means change in the DNA pool.  "The Theory of
Evolution" refers to a theory describing how such
change is produced.   Central to the theory is the
notion of unequal reproductive probability between
genomes, which results in a direction for evolution. 
The modern theory includes the case of equal
reproductive probability, but this a special topic
within the larger theory.  A definition of "The Theory
of Evolution" must stress "Survival of the Fittest",
to use Darwin's phrase.

=====
Mitchell Timin
http://annevolve.sourceforge.net
